searchDocs.title: Colour​
searchDocs.content: Simply changes the colour your beam is

searchDocs.title: Width​
searchDocs.content: Changes how wide your beam is

searchDocs.title: Scale​
searchDocs.content: The divider of your direction value. This is useful if your forces are incredibly large and you want them to fit in a certain space.

searchDocs.title: Overview​
searchDocs.content: VectorViz is an easy to use module which simplifies debugging directions you're applying on your parts by visualising your vectors. The beam scales with the size of your vector allowing you to fine tune the forces you're applying much easier than before.

searchDocs.title: Installation​
searchDocs.content: Unfortunately VectorViz currently doesn't support any package libraries. In order to install this simply copy and paste the module inside the src folder in the Github resporitory and get started!  (https://github.com/fxxizan/VectorViz/blob/main/src/VectorViz.luau)

searchDocs.title: Example​
searchDocs.content: Below is an example on how you can utilise VectorViz to visualise an external air resistance force being applied on a football.   --// Create a beam to represent the air resistance force VectorViz:CreateVisualiser("AirResistance", Ball.Position, Vector3.zero, { Colour : Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0), Width : 0.1, Scale : 1.5 } ) --// Update the beam to continue matching the ball's position and updating the air resistance value local Connection = nil Connection = RunService.Stepped:Connect(function() local AirResistance = -Ball.AssemblyLinearVelocity * math.exp(Ball.AssemblyLinearVelocity.Magnitude ^ 2 / 2750) VectorViz:UpdateBeam("AirResistance", Ball.Position, AirResistance) end) task.wait(5) Connection:Disconnect() VectorViz:DestroyVisualiser("AirResistance") --// Okay I've had enough of visualising, lets destroy the beam

searchDocs.title: Creating a visualiser​
searchDocs.content: Visualisers are incredibly easy to create. Simply call the 'CreateVisualiser' function as so:  VectorViz:CreateVisualiser("AirResistance", Ball.Position, Vector3.zero, { Colour : Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0), Width : 0.1, Scale : 1.5 } )   You have to keep a note of the identifier you pass (the first argument) in order to edit it later on in time or destroy it. Also note that the argument for visuals (the fourth argument) is optional and if you don't pass a setting through then it'll automatically default to the default setting for that specific visual setting.

searchDocs.title: Updating the visualiser​
searchDocs.content: You can update the visualiser's position / direction with the following function:  VisualiserModule:UpdateBeam("AirResistance", Ball.Position, AirResistanceForce)   Similarly you can update how the beam looks if you wish later on:  VisualiserModule:UpdateVisualiserAppearance("AirResistance", { Colour : Color3.fromRGB(0, 255, 0), Width : 0.3, Scale : 0.8 } )

searchDocs.title: Destroying the visualiser​
searchDocs.content: Visualisers can be destroyed like so:  VisualiserModule:DestroyVisualiser("AirResistance")   Note that you can reuse the identifier if you want to after destroying it

searchDocs.title: Settings​
searchDocs.content: </> interface Settings { Colour: Color3?, -- The colour of your visualiser Width: number?,-- How wide your visualiser is Scale: number?,-- How big the scale factor of your direction is } Settings for specifying how your visualiser looks like.

searchDocs.title: CreateVisualiser​
searchDocs.content: </> VectorViz:CreateVisualiser( ObjectName: string,-- The name you want to use to identify your visualiser OriginPoint: Vector3 ,-- The origin of your visualiser Direction: Vector3 ,-- Where your visualiser points towards. The beam scales linearly with the size of your direction Settings: Settings?-- The visuals you want your beam to have ) → () This function creates a visualiser object. You must keep a note of the ObjectName if you want to destroy or update the visualiser

searchDocs.title: UpdateBeam​
searchDocs.content: </> VectorViz:UpdateBeam( ObjectName: string,-- The visualiser you want to edit OriginPoint: Vector3 ,-- The new origin of your visualiser Direction: Vector3 -- The new direction of your visualiser ) → () Simply updates your visualiser to fit your new vector

searchDocs.title: UpdateVisualiserAppearance​
searchDocs.content: </> VectorViz:UpdateVisualiserAppearance( ObjectName: string,-- The visualiser you want to edit Settings: Settings?-- Your new settings ) → () Updates how your visualiser looks

searchDocs.title: DestroyVisualiser​
searchDocs.content: </> VectorViz:DestroyVisualiser( ObjectName: string-- The visualiser you want to destroy ) → () Destroys your visualiser object
